question.text: The correct meaning of the expression 'gynoecium is apocarpous' is

options.text: gynoecium comprises only one pistil which is fused with stamens
gynoecium comprises more than one carpel, all of which are free.
gynoecium comprises more than one carpel, which are fused.
gynoecium comprises only one carpel, which is free.

solution.text: The gynoecium is the female reproductive part of flower and its unit is carpel or pistil. If gynoecium carpel may be single (monocarpellary) or several (multicarpellary). In multicarpellary condition, carpels may be free (apocarpous) or fused (syncarpous). Apocarpous gynoecium can be seen in lotus, rose, etc., while syncarpous gynoecium can be seen in mustard, tomato, etc.
